intro: Carapa macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered campeche, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Meliaceae family, which includes mahogany and other economically important hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers and dark, aromatic wood. It typically grows in humid lowland forests and is valued for its timber and traditional uses. Carapa macrantha plays a significant role in the ecological systems of its native habitats.
